title: Is the Image on the Shroud of Turin a Selfie?
post: Sturp examined the Shroud in 1978 and also took samples, could some one tell me why a carbon test was not done in 1978 or was it done and never told. It seems impossible to think they did all these tests without carbon dating it
author: Vincenzo Giovanni Ruello

title: Is the Image on the Shroud of Turin a Selfie?
post: I don’t believe they had permission at that time to conduct an invasive test. I also suspect they, STERA,assumed the tests they already had planned would prove the Shroud was not authentic. C-14 tests, at that stage, would have been seen as overkill.
author: David Goulet

title: Is the Image on the Shroud of Turin a Selfie?
post: Thats assuming quite a lot isnt David they were suppose to go in without bias not presuming anything and I think they took some samples too,
author: Vincenzo Giovanni Ruello

title: Is the Image on the Shroud of Turin a Selfie?
post: They were supposed to go in unbiased, but if Barry is any example then they did have personal (if not expressed) biases. In retrospect, after their initial studies were complete and they still were filled with questions I’m sure some of them wished they had included C-14 as part of the original parameters.
author: David Goulet
